commitResults.messageTitle: Extract section on setting up into a separate document
commitResults.messageBody:
As students are not required to maintain certain sections of the
developer guide, let's extract those sections into their own files.

The benefits are as follows:
Cutting down on repetition and visual clutter makes it easier for
graders to distinguish between students' work and boilerplate.

Students now have a clear distinction to show them what sections they
are responsible for maintaining.

Let's start by extracting the "Setting Up" section into its own
document.

Remove excess newline that prevented a link from rendering properly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Developer Guide: Specify the label for inter-document xref
commitResults.messageBody:
Linking between different documents produces different behavior compared
to linking within a document, resulting in links being rendered with
the document name as the body instead of the section name.

In our case, links are being rendered with the text DeveloperGuide.html
which does not accurately reflect the destination of the link.

Let's explicitly specify the link text instead.

The link for `Run the tests` points to another link instead of directly
to the relevant document.

Let's remove this redundant jump.

commitResults.messageTitle: Developer Guide: Remove anchor for Testing
commitResults.messageBody:
Since the section on testing has been moved to a separate document,
the old anchor is no longer used.

Let's remove it.

We are dropping support for tutorials in AB-4 as:
- a different set of targeted tutorials are being written for AB-3
- the cost of maintaining two separate sets of tutorials is too high
- students working with AB-4 are expected to be able to cope without
    tutorials

Let's remove the tutorial section GetStartedProgramming and any links to
it since the section will no longer be maintained.

PlantUML is a mature, specialized tool to generate UML diagrams. As it
is avtext-based markup language, it works very well with git (e.g.
produces easy to grok diffs).Moreover, it is an open-source tool which
does not require students to obtain proprietary, paid software to use.

Based on these advantages that PlantUML offer over PowerPoint, let's
adopt PlantUML as the tool of choice to generate UML diagrams.

Introduce a tutorial to help students understand the basics of PlantUML
and how its used in AddressBook to generate diagrams.

Replace .pptx diagram templates with .puml files.

Replace instances of pptx generated diagrams with puml diagrams.

The HelpWindow is the only component that relies on WebView, a
dependency that weighs in at around 70MB, more than quadrupling the size
of the executable jar. As there are plans to customize the jars for each
individual student during the practical examination, this overhead can
lead to further problems (bandwidth in the lecture hall, storage space,
etc).

Let's remove the dependency on WebView by changing HelpWindow to display
a link to the user guide instead.

Feedback from previous students indicated that they have some problem
grokking the code base. Let's address this by having a simple tutorial
where students learn how to apply the tools at hand to trace the
execution flow of code.

Address a regression in ebbb713 where subsequent `help` commands will
spawn a `HelpWindow` maximized, covering the screen.

Disable the resizability and the maximize button completely as it serves
no purpose.

Remove unnecessary call to sizeToScene() as HelpWindow defaults to 
USE_COMPUTED_SIZE and the computed size of all its children nodes are 
available before it is shown.

Remove TODO in HelpWindow.fxml as the initial size is set to computed
size.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add tutorial on how to remove a field
commitResults.messageBody:
In lieu of a tutorial on how to morph which can be hard to write and
maintain, we provide a simpler and shorter tutorial on how to remove a
field instead.

Students trying to morph the product can repeat this tutorial to get the
model to a state where they can work with.
